intro: Oxytropis maydelliana subsp. melanocephala, commonly known as the black-headed locoweed, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive dark purple to black flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Oxytropis maydelliana subsp. melanocephala is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants.
